intro: Cyclostemon macrophyllus var. malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca cyclostemon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. This plant thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests or along riverbanks.
